pullRequest.body:
From LeanAPAP


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [694cbe04b5](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17351/commits/694cbe04b5c00bb874f1c04982bdbf7288022310)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ StarAddMonoid.toStarModuleNNRat`
`+ StarAddMonoid.toStarModuleRat`
`+ star_nnqsmul`
`+ star_nnrat_smul`
`+ star_qsmul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
As the linter is telling you, this lemma already exists as `star_rat_smul`, probably in a better file.

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11151859630/job/30996215115)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11151859630/job/30996215669)
Strictly speaking these should be defined only for the `Division*Ring` cases, right?
Yes, but is there any harm in having them be a bit more general?

No, I guess not; but I think it devalues having two separate naming conventions.

bors d+
Have added docstrings to explain the situation
How does simp prove this?
`conjTranspose_smul` + `star_trivial`
Ah nice, it's the new `StarModule` instance that does it.
Can you tweak the docstring on line 2092?
Can the `nsmul` and `zsmul` lemmas be eliminated in the same way? I think the history here is that there was previously no `Star` instance on these types.

I already investigated this earlier today: No, because the `nsmul` and `zsmul` versions are true without commutativity of addition, but `Module` requires (by its definition) that addition is commutative.

Honestly, I would be happy to require commutativity of addition. Who cares about matrices on an non-comm group?!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `star` commutes with `nnqsmul`
